Package orientationStructures

Class RankingSystem

java.lang.Object
orientationStructures.RankingSystem
public class RankingSystem extends Object
Data structure with utility methods for ranking systems, and for testing for 3-concordance.
Author:
R. W. R. Darling

  • Method Details

    • generateUniformRandomRankTable

      public void generateUniformRandomRankTable()
      Fills each row of this.rankTable with a permutation of {0, 1, 2, ..., n-1}, with subtlety that this.rankTable[j][j] = 0 for all j. Hence shuffling n-1 integers, not n.

    • rejectionSamplerUniform3Concordant

      public OptionalLong rejectionSamplerUniform3Concordant(long maxTrials)
      Parameters:
      maxTrials - limit of number iterations
      Returns:
      OptionalLong containing number of iterations to success if a 3-concordant ranking table is found, or empty if not.

    • generateConcordant

      public void generateConcordant()
      Initializes rankTable and orderedNeighbors using a random acyclic orientation.

    • edgeFlipProcess

      public void edgeFlipProcess(int nSteps)
      Generates a random 3-concordant orientation of the line graph of the complete graph on n objects. Not guaranteed to generate such an object uniformly.

      Performs a random walk on ranking systems (i.e. rank tables), where two rank tables are adjacent if one object x switches the ranks of objects y and z whose ranks differ by one.

      Start with an acyclic orientation induced by a random ordering of the points of the line graph. In particular this is 3-concordant.

      The random walk is "reflected at the boundary" of the 3-concordant ranking systems, in the sense that a step of the walk is disallowed if it makes some voter triangle into a directed 3-cycle.

      Doubts about whether O(n^4) or O(n^3 log(n)) edge flips are needed. The state space of the random walk has about (n!)^n elements.

      Tested in TestRankingSystemRandomWalk class.

      Storage requirement: O(n^2)

      Run time: O(n^3). Twenty seconds at n = 1000.

      Parameters:
      n - size of set S of objects.
      Since:
      7.23.2022.

    • test3Concordance

      public boolean test3Concordance()
      DIAGNOSTIC: checks all n(n-1)(n-2)/6 2-simplices to check none are directed cycles. Method applies one-argument voter2SimplexIsCyclic(int,int,int) method to all integers less than n^3, stopping if a directed 3-cycle is found.
      Returns:
      true if ranking system is 3-concordant.

    • voter2SimplexIsCyclic

      public boolean voter2SimplexIsCyclic(int x, int y, int z)
      Tests whether the 2-simplex {xy, yz, xz} is a directed 3-cycle, using rank table. Returns false when {x, y, z} has less than three distinct elements.
      Parameters:
      x - point
      y - point, different to x
      z - point, different to x and y
      Returns:
      true if xy → xz → yz → xy or xy ← xz ← yz ← xy

    • voter2SimplexIsCyclic

      public boolean voter2SimplexIsCyclic(int m)
      Applies voter2SimplexIsCyclic(int,int,int)(x, y, z) method to x + n*y + n*n*z. Trick to allow use of IntPredicate in test3Concordance().
      Parameters:
      m - < n^3
      Returns:
      true if x < y < z and {xy, yz, xz} is a directed 3-cycle

    • voter2SimplexIsCyclicAfterSwitch

      public boolean voter2SimplexIsCyclicAfterSwitch(int x, int y, int z)
      Tests whether switching the ranks (under x) of points y and z will cause a directed 3-cycle
      Parameters:
      x - base point
      y - point at some rank k, according to x
      z - point at rank k+1, according to x
      Returns:
      true if a directed 3-cycle will occur after switching the ranks (under x) of points y and z.

    • quadrilateralIsCyclic

      public boolean quadrilateralIsCyclic(int t, int x, int y, int z)
      Tests whether the 3-simplex {tx, xy, yz, zt} is a directed 4-cycle, using rank table. Returns false when {x, y, z} has less than three distinct elements.

      False unless points t, x, y, z are all different.

      Parameters:
      t - point
      x - point
      y - point
      z - point
      Returns:
      true if zt → tx → xy → yz → zt (or same with arrows reversed)

    • detect4CyclesFromSample

      public int detect4CyclesFromSample(int sampleSize)
      Checks relative of frequency of 4-cycles; used after edgeFlipProcess(int) to verify that orientation is no longer acyclic.
      Parameters:
      sample - size
      Returns:
      number of 4-cycles detected in random sample of 3-simplices

    • produceAll3ConcordantTables4Points

      public int[] produceAll3ConcordantTables4Points()
      Exhaustive enumeration of 3-concordant ranking systems when n = 4. Called by Exhaust3ConcordantOnFourPoints test class.

      Shows there are 450 3-concordant ranking tables on a set of four points, and 8 of them make {01, 12, 23, 03} a 4-cycle.

      Returns:
      array containing count of 3-Concordant, and count of 3-Concordant with four-cycle {01, 12, 23, 03}

      Returns:
